Row.Text: This unit and all others in adjacent tiles [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Heal 15 Additional HP[ENDCOLOR] per turn.
Trade (Automated)
You regained your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital City!
You have adopted the Reformation social policy and can now add a belief to your religion.
ADD REFORMATION BELIEF
Trade route plundered
{1_PlayerName} plundered the trade route you established between {2_CityName} and {3_CityName}.
An unmet player plundered the trade route you established between {1_CityName} and {2_CityName}.
Filthy barbarians plundered the trade route you established between {1_CityName} and {2_CityName}.
Friendly trade route plundered
{1_PlayerName} plundered the trade route {2_PlayerName} established between {3_CityName} and {4_CityName}.
An unmet player plundered the trade route {1_PlayerName} established between {2_CityName} and {3_CityName}.
Barbarians plundered the trade route {1_PlayerName} established between {2_CityName} and {3_CityName}.
First Influential Culture
{1_CivName} {1_CivName: plural 1?is; other?are;} the first civilization to achieve a culture that is Influential with another player.
An unmet civilization is the first civilization to achieve a culture that is Influential with another player.
No Longer Influential
Your culture is no longer Influential with one or more civs.
You are the first civilization to achieve a culture that is Influential with another player.
Culture Victory Imminent
Your culture only needs to become Influential with 1 more civilization to win a Culture Victory!
Culture Victory Threat
{1_CivName} only needs their culture to become Influential with 1 more civilization to win a Culture Victory!
An unmet civilization only needs their culture to become Influential with 1 more civilization to win a Culture Victory!
Culture Victory In Reach
Your culture only needs to become Influential with 2 more civilizations to win a Culture Victory.
Culture Victory Contender
{1_CivName} only needs their culture to become Influential with 2 more civilizations to win a Culture Victory.
An unmet civilization only needs their culture to become Influential with 2 more civilizations to win a Culture Victory.

A brutally powerful Medieval Era Naval Unit used to wrest control of the seas with its ranged attack. Better at attacking and defending than the normal Galleass it replaces, but more expensive. May only be built by Venice.
Excellent at exploring and fearsome in combat, this Shoshone Unique Unit replaces the Scout. It possesses a promotion that allows it to choose the benefit when uncovering an ancient ruin.
Mounted unit that specializes in quick attacks. May only be built by the Shoshone.
Classical Era Melee unit that has a mystical weapon whose abilities will be discovered the first time it is used in combat. May only be build by Indonesia.
Atomic era ranged Unit that must be adjacent to an enemy to strike.
The Barbarians' replacement of the Chariot Archer.

Archaeologists are a special subtype of Worker that are used to excavate Antiquity Sites to either create Landmark improvements or to extract Artifacts to fill in Great Work of Art slots in Museums, Palaces, Hermitages, and selected Wonders. Archaeologists may work in territory owned by any player. They are consumed once they complete an Archaeological Dig at an Antiquity Site. Archaeologists may not be purchased with [ICON_GOLD] Gold and may only be built in a city with a University.
Specialized in defeating Knights and other mounted units. Only the Zulu may build it. Also performs a first-strike ranged attack before combat.
Powerful melee siege unit which grants a city attack bonus to nearby units when next to an enemy city. May only be built by the Assyrians.
Modern Era infantry unit that earns points toward a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age when it defeats an enemy. May only be built by Brazil.

This unit is much cheaper than the Pikeman, and can pillage without using any movement points. Steals gold when attacking a city. Unlocked through the Mercenary Army social policy, these units may not be built; they must be purchased through gold. May move immediately after purchase.

Heavy Mounted Unit specialized in defeating enemy mounted units. This unit is faster and more powerful than the Lancer, which it replaces. Forces defenders to retreat when it inflicts more damage than it receives. May only be built by the Polish.

Melee naval unit which excels at sea exploration. It has more [ICON_MOVES] Movement than the Caravel, which it replaces, and can perform a one-time ability next to foreign lands to earn [ICON_GOLD] Gold and XP. May only be built by the Portuguese.
Strong infantry Unit capable of paradropping up to 9 tiles from friendly territory. Paratrooper can also move and pillage after paradropping, but cannot enter combat until the following turn.

Powerful Medieval infantry Unit. Only the Japanese may build it. This Unit fights more effectively and helps produce Great Generals more quickly than the Longswordsman, which it replaces. Embarked Samurai can build Fishing Boats in one turn without being consumed (which makes them useful even in times of peace).

The Paratrooper is a late-game infantryman. It is somewhat weaker than a mechanized infantry unit; however, it can parachute up to 9 tiles away (when starting in friendly territory). This allows the paratrooper to literally jump over enemy positions and destroy road networks, pillage vital resources and so forth, wrecking havoc behind his lines. The Paratrooper is at great risk when on such missions, so make sure the target is worth it!
Mounted unit that specializes in Desert warfare and protecting Moroccan lands. Receives combat bonuses when fighting both in Desert tiles and Moroccan territory. May only be built by Morocco.

Establishes sea-based Trade Routes between two civilizations that yields [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Can also be used to deliver [ICON_FOOD] Food or [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production within your own borders after building a Granary or a Workshop.

Establishes land-based Trade Routes between two civilizations that yields [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Can also be used to deliver [ICON_FOOD] Food or [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production within your own borders after building a Granary or a Workshop.

Futuristic infantry unit skilled at dropping into danger from far across the world. Squad can move and pillage after landing but cannot enter combat until the following turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Good Luck, Commander![ENDCOLOR]

Special Infantry Unit of the Modern Era. May only be received through adopting the Volunteer Army tenet of the Freedom Ideology. This Unit has a combat bonus outside of friendly territory but is otherwise very similar to Great War Infantry.
Air Unit designed to wrest control of the skies and intercept incoming enemy aircraft. Only the Japanese may build it. This Unit has a bonus against other Fighters and does not require Oil.

This Venetian unique Great Person replaces the Great Merchant. Aside from the ability to Conduct a Trade Mission, the Merchant of Venice can purchase City-States outright, bringing them under Venetian control as a Puppet.
[ICON_PLUS] Great Musicians
[ICON_MINUS] Great Musicians
[ICON_PLUS] Great Writers
[ICON_MINUS] Great Writers
Does this mean WAR?!? (vs. {1_Team})[NEWLINE]This will also upset {2_Team} because you are plundering a trade route connected to them.
Plundering this trade route will upset {1_Team} because it connects to their city. Are you sure you want to plunder the trade route and upset them?
Plunder Trade Route
Create Great Work
Sell Exotic Goods
Write Political Treatise
Perform Concert Tour
Buy City-State

The Merchant of Venice will use his considerable wealth to purchase a City State and put it under control of Venice as a puppeted city. You gain control of all of the minor civilization's existing units.
Unit must be in a City State's territory that you're not at war with.
Use [ICON_PEACE] Faith to purchase Cathedrals (+1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith, +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness, 1 Great Work of Art slot)
Religion spreads 25% faster (50% with Printing Press)
{1_ReligionIcon} {2_NumFollowers} Followers {3_PressureString} ({4_Num} trade routes)
Recruit a Warrior from the lost tribe.
Convince the remaining population to join one of your cities.
Use this contact with the lost tribe to enhance your [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Use information from the tribe to locate nearby barbarian camps.
Trade with the lost tribe for [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Have a look at their maps.
Study their tools to discover a new technology.
Ask for directions to a nearby reseource.
Use equipment around the tribe to upgrade your unit.
Tell these people that they are barbarians. Repeatedly.
Convince the lost tribe to become a Settler for your civilization.
Convince the lost tribe to become a Scout for your civilization.
Convince the lost tribe to become a Worker for your civilization.
Study with the lost tribe to have your unit gain experience.
Drink the native potions to heal your unit.
Study the lost tribe's religion.
Discover a Great Prophet!
Establish Trade Route
Establish a Trade Route with this unit from this city to another city.
Change Home City
Change the home city of this trade unit. It will arrive at the other city next turn. This allows it to make trade routes from its new home city.
Move to New Port
Move this Admiral to another port city under your control. It can be moved out of the other port next turn.
Are you sure you want to {@1_ActionName}?[NEWLINE]The current Tile Improvement will be replaced and a city connection may be disconnected.
+2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science in cities with a [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connection
Exploration
Sapper
When next to an enemy city, other units within 2 tiles get a 50% Bonus when attacking the city.
Bonus vs Cities (250)
+250% Bonus vs Cities.
Golden Age from Victories
Earn points toward a Golden Age for each enemy killed.
+3 [ICON_MOVES] Movement.
Patriotic War
+1 Movement. Flank attack bonus increased by 25%. +10% [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Defense[ENDCOLOR] against all [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ranged Attacks[ENDCOLOR].

+10% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when fighting in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]OPEN[ENDCOLOR] Terrain. (NO Hills, Forest or Jungle). Flank attack bonus increased by 25%. +10% [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Defense[ENDCOLOR] against all [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ranged Attacks[ENDCOLOR].
+10% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength. Flank attack bonus increased by 25%. +10% [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Defense[ENDCOLOR] against all [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ranged Attacks[ENDCOLOR].
+100% more [ICON_GOLD] Gold and +100% more city-state influence than a normal Trade Mission.
Forces defender to retreat if it inflicts more damage than it receives. A defender who cannot retreat takes extra damage.
Before engaging in melee, this unit has an extra attack.
Buffalo Chest
Buffalo Horns
Buffalo Loins

Homeland Guardian
+25% Bonus in combat in your territory

+15% Bonus in combat in your territory

+50% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when fighting in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Desert[ENDCOLOR]
Full Moon Striker
+1 Movement
Native Tongue
May choose benefit when discovering Ancient Ruins.
Altitude Training
Double movement in hill. +10% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when fighting in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Hill[ENDCOLOR].
Mystic Blade
Promotion is replaced with a randomly chosen new promotion after the unit completes its first combat
Invulnerability
+30% Combat Bonus when defending. +20 Hit Points when healing
Sneak Attack
Flank attack bonus increased by 50%.
Heroism
Unit awards combat bonus to nearby units as if it is a Great General
Ambition
+50% Combat Bonus when attacking. -20% penalty when defending
Restlessness
May Attack Twice. 1 Extra Movement
Recruitment
Heals All Damage If Kills Non-Barbarian Unit
Enemy Blade
Takes 20 Damage If Ends Turn in Enemy Territory
Evil Spirits
-10% penalty when attacking. -30% penalty when defending
Skyranger
May paradrop with extended range (40 hexes)
Lightning Warfare
+15% Combat Bonus when attacking. +1 [ICON_MOVES] Movement. Ignore enemy Zones of Control.
Wolfpack I
+25% Combat Bonus when attacking.
Wolfpack II
+25% Combat Bonus when attacking.
Wolfpack III
+25% Combat Bonus when attacking.
Flight Deck I
Can carry 1 extra air unit.
Flight Deck II
Can carry 1 extra air unit.
Flight Deck III
Can carry 1 extra air unit.
Armor Plating I
+25% Combat Bonus when defending.
Armor Plating II
+25% Combat Bonus when defending.
Armor Plating III
+25% Combat Bonus when defending.
Exotic Cargo
May Sell Exotic Goods when adjacent to a foreign tile to gain [ICON_GOLD] Gold and XP based on distance from capital, but only once.
City Plunder
Steals [ICON_GOLD] Gold equal to 100% of the damage inflicted on a city.

Allows airlifts to or from this city. [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Increases air unit capacity of the city from 6 to 10.[ENDCOLOR] 50% of the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from World Wonders, Natural Wonders, and Improvements (Landmarks, Moai, Chateau) is added to the [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism output of the city. [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism output from Great Works +50%.

Provides 2 [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Person Points (GPP) towards a Great Artist. Add up to two specialists to this building to gain [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and increase the rate of Great Artist acquisition (3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and 3 [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] GPP per specialist).

Provides 1 extra copy of each improved luxury resource near this City. Each source of [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil and each Oasis provides +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Trade routes other players make to a city with a Bazaar will generate an extra 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the city owner and the trade route owner gains an additional 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the trade route.

Unique Indonesian Garden replacement. +25% [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People generation in this City, and +2 [ICON_PEACE] Faith for each World Religion that has at least 1 follower in the city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Unlike the Garden the Candi does not have to be built next to a River or Lake.

+1% [ICON_GOLD] Gold from [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connections. +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from [ICON_RES_SALT] Salt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Land trade routes originating from this city have a 50% increase in range.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Allows [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to be moved from this city along trade routes inside your civilization.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Maximum of 10 of these buildings in your empire.

Unique Polish Stable replacement. +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +15 XP for Mounted Units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Each Pasture worked by this City produces +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

Set.Text: Each source of [ICON_RES_WHEAT] Wheat [ICON_RES_BANANA] Bananas [ICON_RES_DEER] Deer and [ICON_RES_BISON] Bison worked by this City produce +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food.

Row.Text: Unique German Bank replacement. +5% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for each Trade Route your civilization has with a City-State. Trade routes other players make to a city with a Hanse will generate an extra 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the city owner and the trade route owner gains an additional 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the trade route.
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Modifier for Hanse: {1_Num}%

Forms a [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connection with the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital over water (if they're not already [ICON_CONNECTED] connected by land). Sea trade routes originating from this city have a 50% increase in range and produce an additional 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold when connecting to another civilization.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must be built on the coast.

50% of the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from World Wonders, Natural Wonders, and Improvements (Landmarks, Moai, Chateau) is added to the [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism output of the city. [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism output from Great Works +50%.
Unique Zulu Barracks replacement. Grants unique promotions to pre-gunpowder melee units.

+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food from Coast and Ocean Tiles. +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Sea Resources worked by this City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Each source of [ICON_RES_FISH] Fish worked by this City produces +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must be built on the coast.

Provides 3 [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Person Points (GPP) towards a Great Musician. Add up to two specialists to this building to gain [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and increase the rate of Great Musician acquisition (3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and 3 [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] GPP per specialist).

Must have built a Market in all Cities. The cost goes up the more cities there are in the empire. Trade routes other players make to a city with an East India Company will generate an extra 4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the city owner and the trade route owner gains an additional 2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the trade route.

Unique Assyrian Library replacement. +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every 2 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City. Also has a slot for a Great Work of Writing which, when filled, gives extra XP to trained Units.

City must have a Market. Trade routes other players make to a city with a Satraps Court will generate an extra 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the city owner and the trade route owner gains an additional 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the trade route.

Must have built a Hotel in all Cities. The cost goes up the more cities there are in the empire. 100% of the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from World Wonders, Natural Wonders, and Improvements (Landmarks, Moai, Chateau) is added to the [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism output of the city. [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism output from Great Works +100%.
+2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Jungle tiles worked by this City. Allows Archaeologists to be built in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have a Library.
Prod. transfer moved to Caravansary

Provides 1 [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Person Point (GPP) towards a Great Writer. Add up to two specialists to this building to gain [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and increase the rate of Great Writer acquisition (3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and 3 [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] GPP per specialist).
It cannot provide more [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness than there are [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in a city. City must have a Zoo.
A Brazilwood Camp can only be built on a Jungle tile. It provides additional [ICON_GOLD] Gold. After the Acoustics technology is researched it also provides extra [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.

A Feitoria can only be built in a City-State's lands, on a coastal tile without a resource. It provides to you one copy of each Luxury Resource type that City-State has connected, regardless of your status with that City-State, but that copy cannot be traded. It also provides the same +50% defense bonus as a Fort. Can only be built by the Portuguese.

A Kasbah can only be built on a Desert tile. It provides one additional [ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and [ICON_GOLD] Gold. It also provides the same +50% defense bonus as a Fort. Must be built in Moroccan territory.

A Chateau must be built adjacent to a Luxury resource. It may not be adjacent to another Chateau. It provides the same +50% defense bonus as a Fort. Must be built in French territory. When Flight is researched its [ICON_CULTURE] Culture yield increases by 1 and its [ICON_GOLD] Gold output rises by 2.
Must be built in a Holy City. 3 free Missionaries appear.

Gains an additional trade route slot and a Cargo Ship appears in the city. Trade routes other players make to a city with the Colossus will generate an extra 2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the city owner and the trade route owner gains an additional 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the trade route. City must be built on the coast.
Defensive Buildings in all Cities are 25% more effective.
Requires Order. +50% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when building Armor Units. 1 Free Social Policy.
Contains a prebuilt Great Work of Art in the Great Work Slot.

+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for all desert tiles worked by this city (except Flood Plains). Gains an additional trade route slot and a Caravan appears in the city. +6 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture once Archaeology is discovered. City must be built on or next to Desert.

Requires Autocracy. In addition to the +2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness, the Prora Resort also provides +1 more [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for every 2 Policies you have adopted. 1 Free Social Policy. Must be constructed in a coastal city.
Requires Freedom. +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Specialists in every city. 1 Free Social Policy.
Creates a copy of each type of military land unit you control and places the unit near the city where the Terracotta Army is constructed.
All units that are next to it move at double speed through Hills and receive a combat bonus on Hills for the rest of the game.

Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Galleass[ENDCOLOR], the first ranged naval unit. Also allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Harbor[ENDCOLOR], which creates city connections from cities to the capital over the water, producing [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Additionally, the [ICON_GOLD] Gold yield from Fishing Boats is increased.

Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Bazooka[ENDCOLOR], the most powerful ranged Unit and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Atomic Bombs[ENDCOLOR], the first nuclear weapon in the game (note: you must first have completed the Manhattan Project and have [ICON_RES_URANIUM] Uranium available). Also allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nuclear Plant[ENDCOLOR], a building which requires [ICON_RES_URANIUM] Uranium and increases the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of a City.
The Internet automatically doubles the [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism output of all your cities, helping you advance toward a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cultural Victory[ENDCOLOR].

Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Zoo[ENDCOLOR], a building which increases [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in the empire and makes [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages more likely. Also unlocks the ability to found the World Congress.
To maximize your bonus, make sure the Great Work Slots are all filled with Art from the same Era and Civilization.
To maximize your bonus, make sure the Great Work Slots are filled with 2 Great Works of Art and 2 Artifacts with all 4 being from different Eras and different Civilizations.
To maximize your bonus, make sure the Great Work Slots are all filled with Art from the same Era and Civilization.
To maximize your bonus, make sure the Great Work Slots are all filled with Art from different Eras and different Civilizations.
To maximize your bonus, make sure the Great Work Slots are all filled with Writings from different Eras and from Civilizations other than the city owner.

To maximize your bonus, make sure both Great Works are of the same type (both Art or both Artifact), both from the same Era, and either both from the city's civilization, or both from civilizations other than the city owner.
To maximize your bonus, make sure the Great Work Slots are all filled with Writings from the same Era and Civilization.
To maximize your bonus, make sure the Great Work Slots are all filled with Music from the same Era and Civilization.
To maximize your bonus, make sure the Great Work Slots are all filled with Writings from different Eras and different Civilizations.
To maximize your bonus, make sure the Great Work Slots are all filled with Music from different Eras but the same Civilization.

Monument - Upgrade
Improve the existing Monument with a +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture but increase the building maintenance by +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Amphitheater - Upgrade
Improve the existing Amphitheater with a +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture but increase the building maintenance by +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Opera House - Upgrade
Improve the existing Opera House with a +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture but increase the building maintenance by +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Museum - Upgrade
Improve the existing Museum with a +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture but increase the building maintenance by +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Broadcast Tower - Upgrade
Improve the existing Broadcast Tower with a +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +17% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture but increase the building maintenance by +3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Granary - Upgrade
Improve the existing Granary with a +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food but increase the building maintenance by +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Aqueduct - Upgrade
Improve the existing Aqueduct with a +10% [ICON_FOOD] Food carried over after a new [ICON_CITIZEN] is born but increase the building maintenance by +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Hospital - Upgrade
Improve the existing Hospital with a +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food but increase the building maintenance by +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Barracks - Upgrade
Improve the existing Barracks with a +7 XP but increase the building maintenance by +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Armory - Upgrade
Improve the existing Armory with a +7 XP but increase the building maintenance by +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Military Academy - Upgrade
Improve the existing Military with a +7 XP but increase the building maintenance by +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Shrine - Upgrade
Improve the existing Shrine with a +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith but increase the building maintenance by +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Temple - Upgrade
Improve the existing Temple with a +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith but increase the building maintenance by +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Walls - Upgrade
Improve the existing Walls with a +2.5 [ICON_STRENGTH] and +25 HP but increase the building maintenance by +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Castle - Upgrade
Improve the existing Castle with a +3.5 [ICON_STRENGTH] and +13 HP but increase the building maintenance by +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Arsenal - Upgrade
Improve the existing Arsenal with a +4.5 [ICON_STRENGTH] and +13 HP but increase the building maintenance by +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Military Base - Upgrade
Improve the existing Military Base with a +6 [ICON_STRENGTH] and +13 HP but increase the building maintenance by +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Library - Upgrade
Improve the existing Library with a +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population but increase the building maintenance by +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
University - Upgrade
Improve the existing University with a +17% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and +1 [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Scientist Slot but increase the building maintenance by +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
Workshop - Upgrade
Improve the existing Workshop with a +5% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +1 [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Engineer Slot but increase the building maintenance by +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold
